readme:
# ion-item-divider

Item Dividers are block elements that can be used to separate items in a list. They are similar to list headers, but instead of being placed at the top of a list, they should go in between groups of items.
docs: Item Dividers are block elements that can be used to separate items in a list. They are similar to list headers, but instead of being placed at the top of a list, they should go in between groups of items.

docsTags.text: {"ios" | "md"} mode - The mode determines which platform styles to use.
docsTags.name: virtualProp

docsTags.text: - Content is placed between the named slots if provided without a slot.
docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.text: start - Content is placed to the left of the divider text in LTR, and to the right in RTL.
docsTags.name: slot

docsTags.text: end - Content is placed to the right of the divider text in LTR, and to the left in RTL.
docsTags.name: slot

usage.angular:
```html
<ion-item-divider>
  <ion-label>
    Basic Item Divider
  </ion-label>
</ion-item-divider>

<ion-item-divider color="secondary">
  <ion-label>
    Secondary Item Divider
  </ion-label>
</ion-item-divider>

<!-- Item Dividers in a List -->
<ion-list>
  <ion-item-divider>
    <ion-label>
      Section A
    </ion-label>
  </ion-item-divider>

  <ion-item><ion-label>A1</ion-label></ion-item>
  <ion-item><ion-label>A2</ion-label></ion-item>
  <ion-item><ion-label>A3</ion-label></ion-item>
  <ion-item><ion-label>A4</ion-label></ion-item>
  <ion-item><ion-label>A5</ion-label></ion-item>

  <ion-item-divider>
    <ion-label>
      Section B
    </ion-label>
  </ion-item-divider>

  <ion-item><ion-label>B1</ion-label></ion-item>
  <ion-item><ion-label>B2</ion-label></ion-item>
  <ion-item><ion-label>B3</ion-label></ion-item>
  <ion-item><ion-label>B4</ion-label></ion-item>
  <ion-item><ion-label>B5</ion-label></ion-item>
</ion-list>
```

usage.react:
```tsx
import React from 'react';
import { IonItemDivider, IonLabel, IonList, IonItem, IonContent } from '@ionic/react';

export const ItemDividerExample: React.FC = () => (
  <IonContent>
    <IonItemDivider>
      <IonLabel>
        Basic Item Divider
      </IonLabel>
    </IonItemDivider>

    <IonItemDivider color="secondary">
      <IonLabel>
        Secondary Item Divider
      </IonLabel>
    </IonItemDivider>

    {/*-- Item Dividers in a List --*/}
    <IonList>
      <IonItemDivider>
        <IonLabel>
          Section A
        </IonLabel>
      </IonItemDivider>

      <IonItem><IonLabel>A1</IonLabel></IonItem>
      <IonItem><IonLabel>A2</IonLabel></IonItem>
      <IonItem><IonLabel>A3</IonLabel></IonItem>
      <IonItem><IonLabel>A4</IonLabel></IonItem>
      <IonItem><IonLabel>A5</IonLabel></IonItem>

      <IonItemDivider>
        <IonLabel>
          Section B
        </IonLabel>
      </IonItemDivider>

      <IonItem><IonLabel>B1</IonLabel></IonItem>
      <IonItem><IonLabel>B2</IonLabel></IonItem>
      <IonItem><IonLabel>B3</IonLabel></IonItem>
      <IonItem><IonLabel>B4</IonLabel></IonItem>
      <IonItem><IonLabel>B5</IonLabel></IonItem>
    </IonList>
  </IonContent>
);
```

props.name: color
props.docs:
The color to use from your application's color palette.
Default options are: `"primary"`, `"secondary"`, `"tertiary"`, `"success"`, `"warning"`, `"danger"`, `"light"`, `"medium"`, and `"dark"`.
For more information on colors, see [theming](/docs/theming/basics).

props.name: mode
props.docs: The mode determines which platform styles to use.

props.name: sticky
props.docs:
When it's set to `true`, the item-divider will stay visible when it reaches the top
of the viewport until the next `ion-item-divider` replaces it.

This feature relies in `position:sticky`:
https://caniuse.com/#feat=css-sticky

styles.name: --inner-padding-bottom
styles.docs: Bottom inner padding of the item divider

styles.name: --inner-padding-end
styles.docs: End inner padding of the item divider

styles.name: --inner-padding-start
styles.docs: Start inner padding of the item divider

styles.name: --inner-padding-top
styles.docs: Top inner padding of the item divider

styles.name: --padding-bottom
styles.docs: Bottom padding of the item divider

styles.name: --padding-end
styles.docs: Right padding if direction is left-to-right, and left padding if direction is right-to-left of the item divider

styles.name: --padding-start
styles.docs: Left padding if direction is left-to-right, and right padding if direction is right-to-left of the item divider

styles.name: --padding-top
styles.docs: Top padding of the item divider

slots.docs: Content is placed between the named slots if provided without a slot.

slots.name: end
slots.docs: Content is placed to the right of the divider text in LTR, and to the left in RTL.

slots.name: start
slots.docs: Content is placed to the left of the divider text in LTR, and to the right in RTL.
